intro: Tetrazygia urbanii, commonly known as the urbanii tetrazygia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive bluish-green hue. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Tetrazygia urbanii is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
